text: Dmitri Vladimirovich Vrubel (; 14 July 1960 – 13 August 2022) was a Russian painter. He was best known for his painting My God, Help Me to Survive This Deadly Love, which showed communist leaders Leonid Brezhnev and Erich Honecker kissing. This painting was graffiti on the Berlin Wall. He was born in Moscow. Vrubel died on 14 August 2022, at the age of 62 from problems caused by COVID-19 at the age of 62.Умер художник Дмитрий Врубель ==References== Category:1960 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Berlin Category:Russian painters Category:People from Moscow
title: Dmitri Vrubel
